result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:00 AM Defendant David C Halbrucker in court.  Attorney Sarvan Singh Jr. in court for David C Halbrucker.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of the Informatiion, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea.
Defense has received discovery and requests time to obtain records on prior convictions.
State has an offer in the file and will send to the Defense.  
Court addresses WCS letter.
Hearing scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on January 18, 2023 at 09:00 am.
WCS Compliance Letter

Letter to Court dated October 27, 2022 re: request to appear via Zoom

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on October 27, 2022 Request is DENIED.**
Transcript of Preliminary Hearing (Digital Recording) held October 7, 2022

8:29 AM Defendant David C Halbrucker in court.  Attorney Sarvan Singh Jr. in court for David C Halbrucker.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty. Nickolie informs the court that the pretrial offer will be waived with the preliminary hearing proceeding.  Atty. Singh states the defendant acknowledges the waiver of the pretrial offer.  Village of Mukwonago police officer Taylor Zajichek sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Nickolie.  Cross examination by Atty. Singh.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Nickolie moves for bind over.  Atty. Singh makes closing statements.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Atty. Nickolie requests an arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Arraignment on October 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Letter from Atty Singh requesting an adjournment **Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 9/12 "Granted"
Laboratory report filed by the State.
Preliminary hearing on September 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:30 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant David C Halbrucker in court.  Attorney Sarvan Singh Jr. appeared by video for David C Halbrucker. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Filed by attorney - request to appear by zoom.
**Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 08-12-2022. "Granted."
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Hearing on August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:52 PM Defendant David C Halbrucker appeared by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Niki Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Atty Sarvan Singh retained, would like to have friday's date taken off and rescheduled, due to vacation being planned. Sent to Herring for review. Court's response: The court is appreciative of attorney Singh's letter but is denying the adjournment due to notification issues.
filed by Attorney Sarvan Singh, Jr.

Adjustment Number: 22A 030218,
Payable Number: 471250,
Receipt Number: 22R 032538,
Amount: $20.00
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.    Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and drug testing.Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM. The Defendant to report to WCS within one (1) business day of being released. The Court will order that the Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms, however this order is STAYED for 48 hours so that the Defendant can bring all firearms to the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.

01:14 PM Defendant David C Halbrucker in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to seek counsel.  
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant.
The Court will order that the Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms, however this order is STAYED for 48 hours so that the Defendant can bring all firearms to the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
THE COURT AUTHORIZES ZOOM FOR THE NEXT HEARING.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
WCS Pre-trial Report
